commits.message:
Add GATT write descriptor and characteristic operations

Allow to successfully call BluetoothGatt.writeDescriptor()
and BluetoothGatt.writeCharacteristic() methods.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 576827407

Add GATT write descriptor and characteristic operations

pull_request.title: Add GATT write descriptor and characteristic operations.
pull_request.body: Add GATT write descriptor and characteristic operations.

pull_request.title: Testing 'Add ShadowPausedMessageQueue.IdlingMonitor interface.'
pull_request.body:
This interface allows test to monitor whether `Looper` is blocked waiting on its queue. It makes it possible to build tests that try to reach "everything is idle" state without manually pausing/idling loopers. It complements `ShadowPausedLooper.poll(timeout)` adding ability to have similar synchronization on non-main looper.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 576223428

pull_request.title: Revert ShadowPausedMessageQueue.IdlingMonitor change
pull_request.body:
Revert ShadowPausedMessageQueue.IdlingMonitor change

This seems to cause timeouts in ShadowPausedLooperTest.

pull_request.title: Testing 'Add ShadowPausedMessageQueue.IdlingMonitor interface.'
pull_request.body:
This interface allows test to monitor whether `Looper` is blocked waiting on its queue. It makes it possible to build tests that try to reach "everything is idle" state without manually pausing/idling loopers. It complements `ShadowPausedLooper.poll(timeout)` adding ability to have similar synchronization on non-main looper.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 576223428

issue.title: Support non-linear font scaling
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Android SDK 34 supports non-linear font scaling by default. Robolectric should try to emulate it in some way.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

When loading a layout to be tested, any font sizes or dimensions in SP should be converted to pixels using the new non-linear font scaling tables. This only matters if the system font scale is > 1. 

The conversion should happen when the resource is loaded from XML. This typically uses the TypedValue.applyDimension() method to convert SP -> PX. Not sure how it works in Robolectric but if there is a TypedValue shim it should also use the conversion tables when appropriate.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
The Android source for 34 is not public yet, but you can find the same conversion tables in AndroidX: https://cs.android.com/androidx/platform/frameworks/support/+/androidx-main:compose/ui/ui-unit/src/androidMain/kotlin/androidx/compose/ui/unit/fontscaling/FontScaleConverterFactory.kt;l=24?q=fontscaleconverter&sq=

comment.body:
Yep that looks like it's working. Very exciting! Thanks for testing 
-------- Original message --------From: Sergio Sastre Flórez ***@***.***> Date: 10/26/23  14:17  (GMT-08:00) To: robolectric/robolectric ***@***.***> Cc: Tyler Freeman ***@***.***>, Mention ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [robolectric/robolectric] Support non-linear font scaling (Issue #8413) 
I can confirm it works out of the box with Robolectric 4.11-beta2, which support API 34.
use in your test:
@Config(
   sdk = [30, 33, 34],
   fontScale = 2.0f
)
And this is the result for the different SDKs:



30
33
34











—Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>

pull_request.title: Supporting TYPE_ALL in ShadowSensorManager.getSensorList()
pull_request.body:
Supporting TYPE_ALL in ShadowSensorManager.getSensorList()

Before this change, you needed to pass in one specific sensor type to get back the corresponding Sensor object inside a List. Unless you created a ShadowSensor with TYPE_ALL, the map wouldn't find anything keyed by TYPE_ALL (integer value of -1) and it would return an empty list.

issue.title: Support non-linear font scaling
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Android SDK 34 supports non-linear font scaling by default. Robolectric should try to emulate it in some way.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

When loading a layout to be tested, any font sizes or dimensions in SP should be converted to pixels using the new non-linear font scaling tables. This only matters if the system font scale is > 1. 

The conversion should happen when the resource is loaded from XML. This typically uses the TypedValue.applyDimension() method to convert SP -> PX. Not sure how it works in Robolectric but if there is a TypedValue shim it should also use the conversion tables when appropriate.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
The Android source for 34 is not public yet, but you can find the same conversion tables in AndroidX: https://cs.android.com/androidx/platform/frameworks/support/+/androidx-main:compose/ui/ui-unit/src/androidMain/kotlin/androidx/compose/ui/unit/fontscaling/FontScaleConverterFactory.kt;l=24?q=fontscaleconverter&sq=

comment.body: I can confirm it works out of the box with Robolectric 4.11-beta2, which support API 34. use in your test: ```kotlin @Config( sdk = [30, 33, 34], fontScale = 2.0f ) ``` And this is the result for the different SDKs: | 30 | 33 | 34 | | -------- | ------- | ------- | | | | |
